title: XDMarComs
text:
Value-Based Marketing
Students master cutting-edge marketing strategies by analyzing real-world cases, developing data-driven insights, and designing customer-centric campaigns. They leave prepared to drive growth, build powerful brands, and lead innovation in dynamic global markets. Objective: Understand and apply value-driven marketing strategies.
Data and Digital Literacy
Students develop hands-on expertise with R by analyzing real consumer data, extracting actionable insights, and applying advanced methods like conjoint analysis. They finish by delivering an independent marketing project, showcasing their ability to solve complex business challenges with data. Objective: Develop skills in data-driven marketing analysis using R.
Agile and Sustainable Marketing Strategies
Students explore ethical marketing, sustainability, and stakeholder engagement, gaining the tools to lead with integrity in a connected world. They learn to manage responsible communication, uphold research ethics, and promote digital well-being in an evolving digital landscape. Objective: Master agility, sustainability, and ethics in marketing.
Internet of Things (IoT) in Marketing
Students investigate how IoT devices, X-realities, and mobile apps transform consumer behavior and market intelligence. Through hands-on workshops, they design personalized consumer experiences that integrate innovation with social and environmental responsibility. Objective: Learn to leverage IoT, X-realities, and mobile apps in marketing.
Content Creation and Management
Students gain practical skills using tools like Google Forms and RStudio to design surveys, analyze data, and create visually compelling dashboards. They acquire hands-on experience in content management and data visualization, applying insights to drive marketing and communication strategies. Objective: Develop skills in creating engaging digital content and visualizations.
Experiential Marketing
Students learn to design experiential marketing campaigns that seamlessly blend physical and digital touchpoints. They apply technologies like Big Data, AI, and X-realities to create engaging, interactive brand experiences that captivate consumers and drive business results. Objective: Learn to create interactive, hybrid brand experiences.
Reputation and Media Management
Students develop the skills to manage public image, communication channels, and stakeholder relationships effectively. They engage with public relations, media relations, guerrilla marketing, and crisis communication to protect and enhance brand reputation in a dynamic media environment. Objective: Master techniques for managing brand reputation.
Data Analysis and AI
Students acquire skills to analyze data and leverage digital tools, including gamified applications and AR technologies, to extract actionable consumer insights. They apply these insights to inform strategic marketing decisions and drive business impact. Objective: Apply AI tools and digital media analysis in marketing.
Academic Research Design and Consulting Practice
Students learn research design, data collection methods, and consulting practices through hands-on projects. They tackle real-world consulting scenarios, such as business audits and marketing projects, culminating in a research or consulting proposal that demonstrates practical problem-solving skills. Objective: Develop skills in research design and consulting.
Special Topics
Students engage with contemporary trends in experiential digital marketing, analyzing the latest research and industry practices. They develop critical skills to evaluate the impact of marketing strategies on business performance and societal outcomes. Objective: Explore trends and issues in experiential digital marketing.

title: News and Events
text:
01 Lobbying and Public Affairs in Cyprus


















Presented by Mairy Pyrgou, MScPublic Affairs Consultant, President of Fimonoi
This presentation took place as part of the Reputation and Media Management course, focusing on the role of lobbying in influencing government decisions and shaping public perception in Cyprus.


02 Shaping the Wine Tourism Identity & Image of Cyprus: Theoretical and Practical Approaches







































Keynote speakers: Dr. Maria Alempaki – Senior Researcher, Institute of Agricultural Economics and Sociology, ELGO-DIMITRAElina Christofidou – Tourism Officer, Deputy Ministry of Tourism of CyprusIlias Makridis – Operations Coordinator, Cyprus Wine CoreMichalis Georgiou – Wine Journalist
As part of the MSc in Experiential Digital Marketing Communications (XDMarComs@CUT), this seminar—organized with the Institute of Agricultural Economics and Sociology (ELGO-DIMITRA) and supervised by Dr. Maria Alempaki—examines wine tourism identity and digital branding in Cyprus.


03


















Intercultural CommunicationMarcoms in Slovakia, Presented by Lucia Dancisinova, Eva Benkova
A session on Intercultural Communication, Presentation and Communication Skills – Marcoms in Slovakia was delivered by Lucia Dančišinová and Eva Beňková. The presentation introduced a postgraduate program similar to our Master’s in Marketing Communications.


04


















The Marketing and Media landscapes of India, Presented by Geeta Marmaat
This session focused on Indian communication strategies. A visit to their university further enhanced the international scope of the program.

title: Admission Requirements
text:
The XDMarComs MSc is an elite program designed on the basis of state-of-the-art educational design principles and using teaching techniques which combine academic rigour with practical application. It provides a rich learning experience and advances the personal development and professional networking of participants by welcoming a diverse student body. It values both academic achievement and professional experience and provides a personalized learning environment, tailored to individual needs and aspirations. It offers a traditional, academic entry pathway and a professional one.

Professional Route

4-year Bachelor’s degree with a grade of at least 6.5/10 or 3-year Bachelor’s degree with a grade of at least 2:2 Honors - In both cases, the degree needs to have been obtained within the past 5 years.
